channel.title: Homes on R-Ladies NYC
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on R-Ladies NYC

item.description: About R-Ladies NYC is part of a world-wide organization to promote gender diversity in the R community. We aspire to encourage and support women interested in learning and sharing their experience in R programming by hosting a variety of events including talks, workshops, book clubs, data dives, and socials. Join the R-Ladies NYC Slack team! Email nyc@rladies.org to request an invitation. Then check back here or visit our Meetup page for event details.

item.title: Board
item.description: Meet our board members Soumya Kalra (Founder and Organizer) Soumya Kalra is currently a quantitative analyst the within the Market Risk Group for Supervision at the New York Federal Reserve Bank. Previously she worked as a researcher at the Office of Financial Research at the Department of Treasury focusing covering commodities and private funds from a financial stability perspective. She is very passionate about using R in the statistical and data visualization work she performs in her current role.
